answers.answer: I'm not aware of any free resources, but I understand that if you get the right meter, Walmart has very low cost strips. Also many people report buying strips on eBay for greatly reduced prices. I would talk to your doctor or a local clinic, though, because sometime there are special offerings for free diabetes supplies through pharmaceutical companies, etc. I also notice right on this site ads for free supplies through dlifedotcom. They are a reputable organization.

My 2 cents:1. Google search for a free health clinic near you.2. Some hospitals provide free mobile health services for the homeless.3. Try contacting the mfg of your meter.4. J&J still offers free Lifescan One-Touch systems with test strips.

question: Lost health insurance and can't get coverage -had cancer 20 years ago.   I need to know if anyone knows where I can get diabetic strips for free.
title: Diabetic strips
